page.title: 13FARMS AND FARMING,DRAYTON
page.content: Most of the farms in this area are predominantly{arable,}growing wheat and barley,peas and oilseed rape,as well as a great deal of{sugar beet. This is sugar beet country,and during the beet harvest the roads are busy with huge lorries taking the beet from roadside clamps to the processing factories. {Dairy farming}has all but disappeared recently from the area,due mainly to the imposition of{milk {quotas}by the{E.E.C. There is some{beef farming}on land near the river unsuitable for cultivation, and the nearby{turkey farms and processing plant of the {Bernard Matthews}company are made evident by the large number of lorries which come through the area on their way to or from Norwich.
